  • primary – True/False if this is the primary node
  • address – Address of the node for ISY
  • device – The device value we discovered from the AXS Port

class SunSpecDevice(parent, id=0, name='', type=0, addr=0, offset=0)[source]¶

SunSpec Device Class

Parameters:
  • parent – Parent
  • id – ID (0 default)
  • name – Name of device from sunspec tables
  • type – Type of device from sunspec tables
  • addr – Register Address
  • offset – Register offset
OutbackNode.addInverters(controller)[source]¶

Finds all the different types of inverters and adds them to the ISY as appropriate.

Parameters:controller – The full controller object (aka self)
OutbackNode.closeConnection()[source]¶

Closes the connection to the AXS Port

OutbackNode.determineSetup()[source]¶

Takes all the devices found and determines what kind of implementation we have and sets the global type constants.

OutbackNode.getDevices()[source]¶

Function to get all the devices that are present in the system. Performs a scan of all the registers.

OutbackNode.getRegisters()[source]¶

getRegisters for the device based on the registers_needed

OutbackNode.getSerial()[source]¶

Gets the Serial number of the AXS Port (Used for address creation)

OutbackNode.openConnection()[source]¶

The openConnection method to open/re-open or verify connection to AXS Port is open.

OutbackNode.query(**kwargs)[source]¶

Get updated values for the registers

OutbackNode.setRegister(**kwargs)[source]¶

setRegister for the device based on input from the ISY

Parameters:kwargs – The input command from the ISY (dictionary)
OutbackNode.update_info()[source]¶

Update all the registers (runs on short_poll)

OutbackNode.verifySunSpec()[source]¶

Verify that the device returns the ID of a SunSpec device 0x53756E53 at the first 2 bits of register 40000
